title: The market that Nvidia dominates is the biggest in the world, says Jim Cramer
text: 'Mad Money' host Jim Cramer talks today's record market action and how to navigate this bull run.

title: Jim Cramer says faith in growth stocks like Nvidia pays off
text: CNBC's Jim Cramer explained why he thinks investors should have faith in good growth stocks and trust that they can make money in the market. He used artificial intelligence powerhouse Nvidia as an example, explaining why it's his all-time favorite stock.

title: Record Closing Highs for Dow, S&P 500 on Econ & Jobs Strength
text: A strong revision to Q2 GDP ahead of the open seems to have put investors in a good mood today, even as a stronger economy takes away some odds that the Fed will be cutting interest rates.

title: Retail investors move beyond Nvidia, bet on AI laggards
text: On today's Asking for a Trend, host Ines Ferré dives into retail investors looking beyond Nvidia (NVDA) for value in the AI trade — rotating into beaten-down sectors such as solar, cybersecurity, and robotics. Tom Bruni, Stocktwits Editor‑in‑Chief and VP of Community, joins the show to break down the retail-driven sector rotation and explains why many are already pricing in rate cuts this fall.

title: Nvidia's $46.7B Q2 proves the platform, but its next fight is ASIC economics on inference
text: Behind Nvidia's strong quarterlyu results are ASICs gaining ground in key Nvidia segments, challenging their growth in the quarters to come.

title: IREN Stock Rallies After Strong Q4 Earnings Beat, NVIDIA Preferred Partner Status
text: IREN Limited IREN released its fourth-quarter results after Thursday's closing bell. Here's a look at the key figures from the quarter.

title: Taking Profits For Yield And Growth With David Alton Clark
text: David Alton Clark, The Winter Warrior Investor, thinks the market is a little bit toppy with stretched valuations. Focusing on high-conviction positions, trimming the number of holdings, and reallocating gains from growth into income-producing assets for capital preservation.

title: SPX Resistance Push, VIX Treads Lower & NVDA Breakout Potential
text: The SPX moved higher on the session and showed a significant upside channel into 6,500 resistance. Kevin Green says he needs to see that channel hold for the next couple of sessions for bullish optimism to solidify.

title: Nvidia's concentration dependence risk
text: CNBC's Kristina Partsinevelos joins 'The Exchange' to discuss the the pent-up demand for Nvidia's chips and the concentration of customers in the stock.

title: Bokeh Capital's Kim Forrest offers opportunity plays outside of Nvidia
text: Kim Forrest, Bokeh Capital Partners CIO, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss opportunities outside of Nvidia and her read on the overall market.

title: Global markets are mixed after U.S. stocks surged following Nvidia's earnings report
text: World shares were mixed Thursday after modest gains on Wall Street lifted the S&P 500 to another all-time high ahead of computer chipmaker Nvidia's highly anticipated earnings report.The future for S&P 500 rose 0.1% while that for the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.3%. Meanwhile, oil prices declined.In early European trading, Germany's DAX climbed 0.4% to 24,144.65 while Britain's FTSE 100 slipped 0.2% to 9,240.75.

title: Nvidia Stock Down 1.2%. Why Growth May Slow And Why Not To Buy $NVDA
text: Nvidia stock fell 3.2% Wednesday after reporting record sales, falling short on data-center revenue, and predicting cooler growth, according to the Wall Street Journal.

title: Altimeter Capital CEO Brad Gerstner gives his read on Nvidia post-earnings
text: Altimeter Capital's Brad Gerstner joins CNBC's "Halftime Report" to react to Nvidia's earnings last night. The stock is his second largest holding.

title: The Big 3: NVDA, MSFT, C
text: Jason Brown (@brownreport) remains a bull on Nvidia (NVDA). He believes the company's data center revenue is still strong despite the miss, adding that chip sales without China only adds to Nvidia's future potential.

title: Nvidia falls after data center revenue misses estimate
text: NVIDIA, the world's most valuable publicly traded company, gave a tepid revenue forecast for the current period, signaling that growth is decelerating after a staggering two-year boom in AI spending https://bloom.bg/3UMeWnp

title: Surprise! September Is Actually The Worst Month For Stocks. But Don't Panic.
text: September is usually the worst month for the stock market. But it could be different this time for the S&P 500, Nasdaq and the Dow Jones indexes.

title: Nasdaq 100 and S&P500: Nvidia Drops, But AI Buzz and Fed Bets Keep US Stocks Afloat
text: Nvidia slips on cautious China outlook, capping Nasdaq gains as traders eye Friday's PCE data and a potential September Fed rate cut.

title: Nvidia is a victim of it's own success, says Tusk Ventures' Bradley Tusk
text: Bradley Tusk, Tusk Ventures founder and CEO, joins 'Money Movers' to discuss Nvidia's Q2 earnings, the shares slides following the report and outlook for the company.

title: Nvidia Stock Falls After Earnings Report: Critical Price Levels to Keep an Eye On
text: Nvidia (NVDA) shares lost ground Thursday morning even as the AI chipmaker and investor favorite reported revenue and profit that topped analysts' estimates.

title: Nvidia: Priced For Perfection And Still Delivering
text: Nvidia Corporation delivered another strong quarter, beating expectations with robust growth in Data Center, Gaming, Visualization, and Automotive segments. Extraordinary demand for Blackwell GPUs, CUDA's entrenched moat, and a $60B buyback program reinforce my bullish outlook and Buy rating. NVDA stock valuation remains rich and priced for perfection, but Nvidia's growth, profitability, and software stack justify its premium over peers.

title: Jobless Claims Decreased More Than Expected
text: Pre-market futures have lots to digest this morning — not only following NVIDIA's NVDA strong Q2 results after the closing bell last night (even if they came in slightly below certain lofty expectations), but with both important economic data and Q2 earnings results having been reported. The Dow is +42 points at this moment, the S&P 500 is -1 point and the Nasdaq is -21.

title: Nvidia stock: why Seaport Research continues to see 45% downside
text: Nvidia Corp (NASDAQ: NVDA) delivered another quarter of solid earnings– coming in ahead of Street estimates for both top and bottom-line. Executives offered upbeat commentary around the Blackwell chip ramp and reiterated its positive stance on AI infrastructure, forecasting long-term demand from “AI super factories” as well.

title: China clouds Nvidia's quarter
text: CNBC's Kristina Partsinevelos joins 'Money Movers' to discuss the China overhang that impacted Nvidia's Q2 earnings.

title: Dan Ives says Wall Street may be underestimating Nvidia
text: Despite record earnings, Wedbush's Dan Ives argues Nvidia's upside is bigger than Wall Street thinks. Transcript: CAROLINE WOODS: Dan Ives, managing director and senior equity research analyst at Wedbush Securities.

title: CoreWeave Stock Surges As Nvidia's AI Revenue Fires Up
text: CoreWeave, Inc. CRWV stock climbed sharply on Thursday as NVIDIA Corp.'s NVDA AI-driven earnings took center stage.

title: Daily Dividend Report: Nvidia, Deere, BEN, Nordson, Guess
text: NVIDIA will pay its next quarterly cash dividend of $0.01 per share on October 2, 2025, to all shareholders of record on September 11, 2025.

title: Nvidia Q2 Guidance Shows Demand Outstrips Supply For 'New Oil And Gold Of AI Revolution'
text: Nvidia Corporation NVDA analysts are highlighting the company's growth in the second quarter and pending opportunity as China regulations become clear.

title: Has Nvidia's AI Boom Hit a Wall? | What Next for $4 Trillion Giant
text: Nvidia, the world's most valuable company, gave a tepid revenue forecast for the current period, signaling that growth is decelerating after a staggering two-year boom in artificial intelligence spending. Sales will be roughly $54 billion in the fiscal third quarter, which runs through October, the company said in a statement.

title: Nvidia's Huang, Kress See Chance to Bring Blackwell to China
text: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and CFO Colette Kress comment on the company's forecast for the current period and prospects in China. Nvidia said sales will be roughly $54 billion in the fiscal third quarter.

title: Nvidia Forecasts Decelerating Growth After Two-Year AI Boom
text: Dan Ives, Global Head: Technology at Wedbush Securities, breaks down Nvidia earnings and offers his outlook for AI. Nvidia Corp., the world's most valuable company, gave a tepid revenue forecast for the current period, signaling that growth is decelerating after a staggering two-year boom in artificial intelligence spending.

title: Nvidia earnings takeaways, plus what will move the markets next
text: Here is some of what was discussed on Morning Brief for Thursday, August 28. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley and Gabelli Funds portfolio manager John Belton share some of their takeaways from Nvidia's big second quarter earnings report.

title: NVDA Evolving from Chip Company to A.I. Ecosystem Developer
text: CFRA's Angelo Zino raised his price target on Nvidia (NVDA) after the company's blockbuster earnings report. While he notes the disappointing miss in data center revenue, it's "all upside in China" after CEO Jensen Huang set the bar low on the previous quarter.

title: Big Morning for Q2 Numbers: GDP +3.3%, Earnings Beats for Retailers
text: Q2 GDP improves by 30 bps from the initial print, +3.3%, and 20 bps above expectations.

title: Cantor Fitzgerald's CJ Muse on Nvidia: Our estimates move higher with growing 2026 confidence
text: CJ Muse, Cantor Fitzgerald analyst, joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss his reaction to Nvidia's earnings, expectations for the year, and much more.

title: US tech valuations 'flash red' in dotcom bubble levels, warns investment bank
text: Valuations in the artificial intelligence sector are approaching dotcom-era levels, UBS has warned, with US technology stocks trading at an economic price-to-earnings multiple above 35 times. The bank noted that excitement around AI has driven unprecedented investment, with combined capex from Meta (NASDAQ:META), Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG), Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) this year expected to exceed that of the entire listed energy and utilities sectors in the US and Europe.

title: Nvidia's AI Fortress Shows 'First Crack'—The China Risk Just Got Real
text: For months, Nvidia Corp NVDA has been Wall Street's undisputed AI darling, but this quarter may mark the first wobble in its flawless run. Despite delivering strong results, the company's softer-than-hoped guidance and growing uncertainty around China exposed what Direxion's Head of Capital Markets Jake Behan called "the first real crack" in its AI growth story.

title: Nvidia shares under pressure despite earnings beat
text: Nvidia's stock fluctuated on Thursday as investors digested the company's latest earnings report, which signaled robust AI demand but provided little clarity on China. CNBC's Kristina Partsinevelos joins 'Squawk on the Street' to break down the details.

title: US Stocks Mixed; Nvidia Posts Upbeat Earnings
text: U.S. stocks traded mixed this morning, with the Dow Jones index falling around 0.2% on Thursday.

title: Nvidia: AI Fatigue Is Here
text: Nvidia remains the global AI leader, delivering stellar earnings and robust growth, but signs of 'AI fatigue' and profit-taking are emerging. Despite strong financials and guidance, Nvidia's valuation is high, and the stock is priced for perfection, raising concerns about future downside risk. Sustaining high margins and growth depends on continued AI demand; increased competition and potential AI infrastructure slowdowns are key risks.

title: Blackwell Now NVDA's Story, SNOW Shows Software Isn't Dead
text: Jenny Horne goes off Nvidia's (NVDA) gargantuan earnings report that showed a miss on data center revenue but highlighted other bright spots, including Blackwell. She lays out Nvidia's path ahead as shares rebound from Wednesday's post-earnings sell-off.

title: NVIDIA Stock Could Pull Back in September, But Don't Bet on It
text: There are reasons to believe that NVIDIA's NASDAQ: NVDA stock price could pull back in September, but it's not a possibility worth betting on. Although the approximately 100% stock price advance since April provides ample reason to take profits, the Q2 results and guidance do not.

title: Nvidia CEO says he's in talks with Trump admin about selling Blackwell chip to China
text: Nvidia's CEO discussed his talks with the Trump administration on potential Blackwell chip sales to China, and how AI adoption of U.S. tech helps win the AI race.

title: Nvidia-rival Cambricon sees its shares surge, report of Mexico increasing tariffs on Chinese goods
text: Morning Brief: Market Sunrise takes a look at the biggest stories moving markets the morning of August 28, including Nvidia's earnings, the move in Cambricon shares, and a Bloomberg report that Mexico may increase tariffs on goods imported from China. #youtube #investing #stockmarket About Yahoo Finance: Yahoo Finance provides free stock ticker data, up-to-date news, portfolio management resources, comprehensive market data, advanced tools, and more information to help you manage your financial life.

title: Nvidia Q2: Stock Drops Over China Concerns
text: Nvidia Corporation delivered strong Q2 FY2026 results, but growth is slowing and after-market stock reaction was weak due to several headwinds. Revenue is increasingly concentrated among a few large U.S. corporate customers, with global diversification and growth in key markets like China and India under pressure. Geopolitical tensions, export controls, and tariffs are impairing Nvidia's long-term international growth prospects, making NVDA more of an "American" company than a global leader.

title: NVIDIA Q2 Earnings Beat, Stock Falls on Data Center Sales Miss
text: NVDA's Q2 earnings and revenues top estimates, but shares slide as Data Center sales miss analyst expectations.
